titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to John B. Lindsey
CWG13807

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1865 Horse Settlements, Salaries, Ins. Bureau, Gen. Receipts, Correspondence Regarding Troops; Center Stack

body.p:
No. 22.
THE STATE OF KENTUCKY,
To John B Lindsay Dr

row.cell: To Services Rendered as asssistant Pay Master for the State of Kentucky, @ $100 per month, during the months of December 1864 and January 1865.

body.p: Approved, and the Q. M. Genl of Ky is ordered to pay Same out of Militrary fund.

Thos E Bramlette
Govr of Ky
I Certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.

D. W. Lindsey
Insp & Adjt Quarter-Master Gen. of Ky.
Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 31 of January, 1865, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter-Master General of Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Two hundred Dollars and -- Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 22.
No. 76 ^75^ Abstract B Qr. 186.
Jno B. Lindsey
Dollars 200 x/100
Paid January 31, 1865.
Salaries
Certificate No 87
